result.execSummary:
The defendant Claude Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim.witness surcharges are to be paid by 5-9-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, if employed and school, if enrolled. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5-9-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Court advised the defendant that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 26 days time served.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may not longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Claude Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Claude Moore in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Claude Moore in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 26 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, if employed and school, if enrolled.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/9/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/9/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Claude Moore in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Claude Moore in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defense makes motion that bail be amended down.  Arguments heard, Court denies motion.  Bail is not amended.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Claude Moore in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Claude Moore in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
